坎.definition: pit; threshold; one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing water; ☵

坎兒井.definition: karez, qanat or "horizontal well" (irrigation and water management system used in Xinjiang, Central Asia and Middle East)

坎坷.definition: (of a road) bumpy; (of life) rough; to be down on one's luck; to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes

坎坷不平.definition: potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes

坎坷多舛.definition: full of trouble and misfortune (usu. referring to someone's life)

坎塔布連山脈.pinyin: kǎn tǎ bù lián shān mài
坎塔布連山脈.definition: Cantabrian mountain range in north Spain dividing Asturias from Castilla-Leon

坎塔布里亞.definition: Cantabria, Spanish autonomous region, capital Santander 桑坦德[Sang1 tan3 de2]

坎特伯雷故事集.pinyin: kǎn tè bó léi gù shì jí
坎特伯雷故事集.definition: The Canterbury Tales, collection of stories by Geoffrey Chaucer 喬叟|乔叟[Qiao2 sou3]

坎肩兒.definition: erhua variant of 坎肩[kan3 jian1]

坎貝爾侏儒倉鼠.pinyin: kǎn bèi ěr zhū rú cāng shǔ
